subject: Re: [junit] how to force junit test methods to be run in certain order?
msgSnippet: Although i won t provide much help on this ... from a philosophical stand point your unit tests should be independant of the order in which they execute. if
messageBody:
Although i won't provide much help on this ... from a
philosophical stand point your unit tests should be
independant of the order in which they execute.

if you have pre/post-requisites i suggest you use
setup and teardown.

consider expecting order of invocation as bad practice
:o)

Blue.

--- vicki_nitchiporouk <vicki_nitchiporouk@...>
wrote:
> It seems that I solved this problem by inserting
> numbers in the test
> methods' names, i.e test1Register, test2Unregister,
> test3LogOut, and
> so on. When I run my junit suite as a regular
> console program the
> order of test methods is observed, but when I run
> JUnit suite from
> ant test order is reversed. Any idea how can I force
> a proper order
> of test method execution while running junit from
> ant?
> Thanks very much for help!
>
>
>
